text: No, the tirgger is working in GTM but leads are still coming through via offline sources in HubSpot
To my knowledge you could possibly create a serverless function and use that library with hupspot api to do this. Use the workflow to Call the function
Thanks a lot man.

John is correct, the crypto library is not supported in workflow custom actions yet. You’d need some kind of external service (HS serverless functions, Firebase, Google Cloud Functions, AWS Lambda, a VPS app, etc…) to generate the code, which could then be referenced later in the workflow.
Thanks a lot for the Help :smile:
<@U7SL518D6> or anyone can please let me know, if we can submit some open source code snippets here - <https://www.HubSpot.com/programmable-automation-use-cases>
click the 3rd card

Here’s the form that the third item links off to, so you can submit some: <https://form.asana.com/?k=-XZRYnzY1js6ys-_cApQig&d=8587152060687>

Thanks <@U7SL518D6> and <@UV23JHEJY>

Ok guys, banging my head against a wall here... I have a blog post template with some additional fields added to be displayed separate from the blog content. That's all good. I can display this additional field on the blog listing page. Fine. But I have a custom module feeding blog items on another page... and the value isn't populating. Using: {{ content.widgets.field_name.body.value }}

What am I missing? I've done this before, but have slept since then. Or just getting old maybe. :)

My site adds a trailing question mark to the URL of every page…
E.g. <http://example.com/page?|http://example.com/page?>
I'm coming up empty searching for a cause / fix. Any ideas?
What variable are you using in the loop for the oteher page?
for instance
```{% for blog in blogs %}```
so it would be `{{ blog.widgets.field_name.body.value }}`
Hope that Helps
Using for "recent_post"... but that isn't working either in place of "content".
Ugh... must've been some cache issue cause I switched it back to "recent_post" and it works now. :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks!
no. can you show me your for loop?
ah i see.
I woudlnt use for content in contents outside of the blog template
i woudl set your own variables
caus eit will be less confusing.
